titles: The old miser slighted: or, The young lasses resolution to marry the young man that she loves, and not be troubled with the groans of gouty fornicator, for the benefit of his riches. To the tune of I often for my Jenny strove. Licensed according to order.
publisher: Printed for P. Brooksby, J. Deacon, J. Blare, J. Back.,
notes: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Verse: "My mother duns me e'ery day ..."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
